metadata.Title: CVE-2012-5650 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - low.
metadata.Description:
Cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerability in the Futon UI in Apache CouchDB before 1.0.4, 1.1.x before 1.1.2, and 1.2.x before 1.2.1 allows remote attackers to inject arbitrary web script or HTML via unspecified parameters to the browser-based test suite.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2012-5650` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

couchdb - 1.2.0-5ubuntu1
couchdb-bin - 1.2.0-5ubuntu1
couchdb-common - 1.2.0-5ubuntu1
No subscription required

notes.Note: jdstrand> Workaround is to disable the Futon interface (see full-disclosure information)

criterions.comment: couchdb package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.2.0-5ubuntu1').
